topic: Complete UI Testing - All Box Types
subject: System Testing

content.heading: Testing Maximum Content with HTML, Images, and Multiple Highlights
content.body:
This is a very long heading to test text wrapping

This paragraph contains bold text, italic text, underlined text, and code snippets. It also has clickable links and special characters: < > & ¬© ¬Æ ‚Ñ¢

Testing very long continuous text without spaces: supercalifragilisticexpialidociousthisisaverylongwordthatshouldbreakorwrapproperly

This is a blockquote with nested formatting and multiple lines.
Second line of blockquote.
Third line with more text.
  • Unordered list item 1
  • Unordered list item 2 with bold
  • Unordered list item 3
  1. Ordered list item 1
  2. Ordered list item 2
  3. Ordered list item 3
Column 1Column 2
Data 1Data 2
highlights: Fourth highlight - very long text that should wrap properly on mobile devices and desktop screens

content.title: Testing 15 Points (Maximum Recommended)
points: Point 4: Very long point that should wrap properly across multiple lines on both mobile and desktop devices without breaking the layout

content.definition:
This is a very long definition to test how the box handles extensive content with multiple HTML tags, special characters (< > &), and line breaks.

Second paragraph of definition with more text to ensure wrapping works correctly on all screen sizes.
content.etymology: From Latin 'superlongwordus' meaning 'ridiculously long word that tests text wrapping' - this etymology is also intentionally long to test the UI
examples: Example 3: Very long example that spans multiple lines to ensure proper wrapping in the definition box on both mobile and desktop screens
Example 5: Testing maximum examples with emoji üéØ

points: Mixed content with code snippets and links
Very long point that should wrap properly on mobile devices with small screens and also look good on large desktop monitors
Final point to test maximum recommended limit
content.keyTakeaway:
This is a very long key takeaway with multiple sentences to test how the summary box handles extensive key takeaway content with HTML formatting, special characters (< > &), and line breaks.

It even has a second paragraph to stress-test the layout!

breakdown.meaning: Testing word wrapping in meaning field with a very long continuous text
Very long meaning text that spans multiple lines to ensure proper wrapping and layout consistency across different screen sizes and devices
Final item at maximum limit - tenth breakdown item
